intro: Microlicia gardneri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and yellow, making it a popular ornamental plant. Microlicia gardneri is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ability to bloom indoors under proper care.
